page.title: 20Farming in Swepstone
page.content: Swepstone no longer has so many working farms as it had in the past. There are only three small ones now. Dishley Grange is a small dairy farm and the farmer does contract work, such as ploughing other farmers' fields. Upper Fields Farm has 27 acres and rents ten. Over the years, it has decreased from a dairy and mixed to an arable farm, and they have sold off most of their land so it is now very small. Church Farm has been in the family for 16 years. It has 6 acres grassland and 5 acres with farm building on. It is a small, part-time holding. The farm is worked by the family. They have a tractor, nine calves, six horses and five hundred turkeys. The farm has decreased in size over the years.
